action.action-desc: Mr. Thompson of Mississippi (for himself and Ms. Jackson Lee) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services, and in addition to the Committee on Homeland Security, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To extend the Terrorism Risk Insurance Program of the Department of the Treasury for 10 years, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fostering Resilience to Terrorism Act of 2013.
Section 102(1) of the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 (15 U.S.C. 6701 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking Secretary, in concurrence with and inserting the following: Secretary of Homeland Security, in concurrence with the Secretary of the Treasury,;
in subparagraph (B), in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking Secretary and inserting Secretary of Homeland Security; and
in subparagraph (D), by striking Secretary and inserting Secretary of Homeland Security.

section.header: 10-year extension of Terrorism Risk Insurance Program

subsection.text: Subparagraph (G) of section 102(11) of the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 (15 U.S.C. 6701 note) is amended by striking 2014 and inserting 2024.
Subclause (III) of section 103(e)(7)(E)(i) of the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 (15 U.S.C. 6701 note) is amended by striking 2017 and inserting 2024.
Subsection (a) of section 108 of the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 (15 U.S.C. 6701 note) is amended by striking 2014 and inserting 2024.

subsection.header: Ongoing reports regarding market conditions for terrorism risk insurance
subsection.text: Paragraph (2) of section 108(e) of the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 (15 U.S.C. 6701 note) is amended by striking and 2013 and inserting 2013, 2017, 2020, and 2023.
Section 103 of the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 (15 U.S.C. 6701 note) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Provision of homeland security information and best practices to insureds
subsection.text: The Secretary of Homeland Security shall provide to insureds under the Program, through the Secretary of the Treasury—

paragraph.text: timely homeland security information, including terrorism risk information, at the appropriate classification level; and
information on best practices to foster resilience to an act of terrorism.

subsection.header: Research on program participation and best practices
subsection.text: The Secretary of Homeland Security shall conduct research to determine the extent to which insureds participating in the Terrorism Risk Insurance Program under title I of the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 (15 U.S.C. 6701 note)—in particular, insureds in critical infrastructure sectors as identified by such Secretary—incorporate information provided under section 103(j)(2) of such Act into business operations. Not later than the expiration of the 12-month period that begins upon the Secretary of Homeland Security commencing the provision of information pursuant to such section 103(j)(2), such Secretary shall submit a report regarding the findings of the research conducted under this subsection to the Committees on Homeland Security and Financial Services of the House of Representatives and the Committees on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs and Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate.
